block.p: Christine Phyllis Parlamis, the daughter of Marguerite and Michael Parlamis of Tenafly, N.J., was married there yesterday to Scott Christopher McAllister, a son of Lynne and Sidney McAllister of Upper St. Clair, Pa. The Rev. John Alexandrou performed the ceremony at the Greek Orthodox Cathedral of St. John the Theologian.

The bride, 28, is a manager of new business for American Express in Manhattan. She graduated from Columbia and received an M.B.A. from the University of Michigan. Her father owns Frank Parlamis Inc., a restaurant construction company in Brooklyn. Her mother is an adjunct professor of English as a second language at the Teaneck, N.J., campus of Fairleigh Dickinson University.

Christine Phyllis Parlamis, the daughter of Marguerite and Michael Parlamis of Tenafly, N.J., was married there yesterday to Scott Christopher McAllister, a son of Lynne and Sidney McAllister of Upper St. Clair, Pa. The Rev. John Alexandrou performed the ceremony at the Greek Orthodox Cathedral of St. John the Theologian.

The bride, 28, is a manager of new business for American Express in Manhattan. She graduated from Columbia and received an M.B.A. from the University of Michigan. Her father owns Frank Parlamis Inc., a restaurant construction company in Brooklyn. Her mother is an adjunct professor of English as a second language at the Teaneck, N.J., campus of Fairleigh Dickinson University.

The bridegroom, 29, is a marketing manager for the Web site hosting division of Dell Computer in Austin, Tex. He graduated from Indiana University at Bloomington and received an M.B.A. from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. His mother is a former substitute elementary school teacher who worked in the public schools in Upper St. Clair. His father is a C.P.A. and management consultant in Pittsburgh.
